item.title: Features With Color Blocks
item.dc:creator: admin
item.content:encoded:
[vc_row][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_icon type="material" icon_material="vc-material vc-material-beach_access" color="white" background_style="rounded" background_color="custom" size="lg" align="center" custom_background_color="#f2d357"][vc_custom_heading text="Certainty or Confidence" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:center" use_theme_fonts="yes" css=".vc_custom_1482319503939{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1482319517338{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"]

Two examples of image are local edge orientation and local velocity in an image sequence.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_icon type="material" icon_material="vc-material vc-material-card_travel" color="white" background_style="rounded" background_color="custom" size="lg" align="center" custom_background_color="#50b8e5"][vc_custom_heading text="Averageability" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:center" use_theme_fonts="yes" css=".vc_custom_1482319527619{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1482319546454{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"]

In addition to having certainty measures included in the representation, the representation of the corresponding feature values may itself be suitable.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/3"][vc_icon type="material" icon_material="vc-material vc-material-texture" color="white" background_style="rounded" background_color="custom" size="lg" align="center" custom_background_color="#f2d357"][vc_custom_heading text="Feature Vectors" font_container="tag:h4|text_align:center" use_theme_fonts="yes" css=".vc_custom_1482319559558{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1482319570448{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"]

In some applications it is not sufficient to extract only one type of feature to obtain the relevant information from the image data.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row full_width="stretch_row" gap="10" equal_height="yes"][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1482319156118{background-color: #f2d357 !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Computer Vision" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff" use_theme_fonts="yes" css=".vc_custom_1482319406288{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1482319420947{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"]

In computer vision and image processing, a feature is a piece of information which is relevant for solving the computational task related to a certain application.

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Learn More" style="custom" custom_background="#50b8e5" custom_text="#ffffff" css=".vc_custom_1482319787775{padding-bottom: 25px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1482319166007{background-color: #50b8e5 !important;}"][vc_custom_heading text="Feature Representation" font_container="tag:h2|text_align:left|color:%23ffffff" use_theme_fonts="yes" css=".vc_custom_1482319442940{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1482319470020{padding-right: 35px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"]

A specific image feature, defined in terms of a specific structure in the image data, can often be represented in different ways.Â 

[/vc_column_text][vc_btn title="Learn More" style="custom" custom_background="#f2d357" custom_text="#ffffff" css=".vc_custom_1482319796742{padding-bottom: 25px !important;padding-left: 35px !important;}"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
